units.title: Tissue sectioning and PBS placement
units.text: the tissue was then cut into small sections of ~2” × 2” and placed into a 15 cm dish ﬁlled with PBS++ (PBS supplemented with
units.rationale: Describes how tissue is cut and transferred to PBS for downstream processing.

units.title: Crypt isolation with EDTA and Matrigel
units.text: resuspended in 25 mL of 2.5 mM EDTA in PBS and placed in an end- media containing 2% Matrigel was added per well. It is critical that over-end rotator at 37 °C until crypts were visible, around 12
units.rationale: Details the EDTA treatment and Matrigel overlay to isolate intestinal crypts.

units.title: Y‑27632 addition and imaging schedule
units.text: h 10 µM Y-27632 was added. Media was changed chamber. Organoids were then imaged on a Nikon spinning disc conevery other day to organoid growth media.
units.rationale: Specifies the use of ROCK inhibitor and the imaging frequency for organoid cultures.

units.title: Microwell plate seeding and PBS wash
units.text:
The plate was placed in the tissue 30 min in the microwell plates. Organoids were then washed with PBS
Organoids were then resuspended in primary antibody diluted using the HTODemux function in R.
units.rationale: Outlines the seeding of organoids into microwell plates followed by a PBS wash.

units.title: Wash steps in organoid wash buffer
units.text: washed three times (2 h per wash at 4 °C on a rocker) in organoid wash buffer
units.rationale: Describes the repeated washing protocol to remove excess reagents.

units.title: Resuspension in CUBIC‑R clearing solution
units.text: After the final wash, organoids were resuspended in 60 μL of CUBIC-R (TCI).
units.rationale: Indicates the clearing step prior to imaging.

units.title: Enzymatic dissociation with enzyme mixes
units.text: 10 min, after which enzyme mix 2 was added. Organoids were kept at 10 °C throughout dissociation for up to 60 min, and were removed every 10 min to be pipette mixed with a P1000
units.rationale: Details the sequential enzyme treatment and temperature control for tissue dissociation.

units.title: Antigen retrieval by ER1 incubation
units.text:
Slides were incubated with ER1 (AR9961, Leica) at 100 °C for 20 min to retrieve antigens.
Organoids were then imaged on a Nikon spinning disc confocal to collect ﬂuorescence and DIC images, and the % area of caspase was quantiﬁed using FIJI66 as the
units.rationale: Specifies the heat‑induced antigen retrieval step for slide‑based assays.
